greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Values of x+y where p runs through the primes of form 4k+1 and p=x^2+y^2, 0<=x<=y.
comment: Also values of y where p runs through the primes of form 4k+1 and 2*p=x^2+y^2, 0 <x<y. - _Colin Barker_, Jul 07 2014
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: N:= 100: # to get values corresponding to primes <= 4*N+1
F:= proc(p) local f; f:= GaussInt:-GIfactors(p)[2][1][1]; abs(Re(f))+abs(Im(f)) end proc:
mathematica: pp = Select[ Range[200] // Prime, Mod[#, 4] == 1 &]; f[p_] := x + y /. ToRules[ Reduce[0 <= x <= y && p == x^2 + y^2, {x, y}, Integers]]; A079886 = f /@ pp (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 15 2015 *)
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Jan 13 2003
